summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The parties agree that Government Exhibits 781, 782, and 783 are authentic copies of education records from the Palm Beach School District in Florida, and that the stipulation itself (Exhibit 1003) may be admitted as evidence at trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (S2 20 CR 330) who, through her attorneys, agrees to the stipulation regarding the authenticity of school records.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signs the stipulation on behalf of the government.

events.title: Stipulation Filed in Maxwell Case
events.description: The prosecution and defense file a joint stipulation agreeing to the authenticity of Palm Beach School District records (Government Exhibits 781-783) for use as evidence at trial.

keyFacts: The document is a formal court stipulation from November 2021 in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330).
The parties agree that Government Exhibits 781, 782, and 783 are authentic education records from the Palm Beach School District in Florida.
The stipulation itself is marked as Government Exhibit 1003 and is admissible as evidence at trial.
The records are described as business records created by the school district with knowledge, near the time of the events, and maintained in the regular course of business.
